revised_title: Buckling Interactions in Sandwich Structures: A Six Degree-of-Freedom Analysis
tldr: This article presents a six degree-of-freedom analysis for sandwich structures, focusing on the interactive buckling behavior in compressed elastic structures. The study identifies a progressive destabilization process, where a triggering bifurcation into an overall mode of buckling is followed by secondary bifurcation into an unstable combination of at least two local modes. The analysis considers bending, shear, and longitudinal stiffnesses of the core and provides insights into the critical loads and associated post-buckling responses.
